title: Smart Data Models - Switch
description: Adapted from CIM data models. A generic device designed to close, or open, or both, one or more electric circuits.  All switches are two terminal devices including grounding switches.

type.description: Property. NGSI type. It has to be Switch

SwitchSchedules.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Text'. A SwitchSchedule is associated with a Switch. Default: 'list'

normalOpen.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. The attribute is used in cases when no Measurement for the status value is present. If the Switch has a status measurement the Discrete.normalValue is expected to match with the Switch.normalOpen. Default: False

open.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. The attribute tells if the switch is considered open when used as input to topology processing. Default: False

ratedCurrent.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. The maximum continuous current carrying capacity in amps governed by the device material and construction. Default: 0.0

retained.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Branch is retained in a bus branch model.  The flow through retained switches will normally be calculated in power flow. Default: False
